```{r setup, include = FALSE}
library(vetiver)
library(tidymodels)
library(pins)
library(plotly)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
pins <- get_vetiver_dashboard_pins()
b <- pins$board

## This function creates example modeling artifacts for the purposes of 
## demonstration. It will:
##  - fit an example model to training data
##  - pin the vetiver model to a temp board
##  - compute metrics from testing data
##  - pin these metrics to the same temp board
## These are steps that must be completed before monitoring
pin_example_kc_housing_model(b, pins$name)

## load new validation data, for example from database or API
validation_df <- mlr3data::kc_housing %>%
    arrange(date) %>%
    filter(date >= "2015-01-01") 

v <- vetiver_pin_read(b, pins$name, version = pins$version)
v_meta <- pin_meta(b, pins$name)
validation_aug <- augment(v, validation_df)

metrics_pin_name <- paste(pins$name, "metrics", sep = "_")

new_metrics <-
    validation_aug %>%
    vetiver_compute_metrics(date, "week", price, .pred)
    
vetiver_pin_metrics(b, new_metrics, metrics_pin_name)

```



### Model metrics

```{r}
p1 <- new_metrics %>%
    filter(.metric %in% c("rmse", "mae")) %>%
    vetiver_plot_metrics() +  
    scale_size(range = c(0, 5))

p1 <- ggplotly(p1)
hide_legend(p1)
```


***

Plot model metrics over time to *monitor* your model.

### Explore validation data

```{r}
p2 <-
    validation_df %>%
    ggplot(aes(price, after_stat(density), fill = waterfront)) +
    geom_histogram(alpha = 0.7, position = "identity") +
    labs(fill = NULL)

ggplotly(p2)
```
